meanings.definition: A subatomic particle that is a meson with a mass approximately 270 times that of an electron.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study pions to learn more about particles in atoms.
meanings.sent2: The lab detected several pions during the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The pions in the atom party were the life of the nucleus!
meanings.sent4: Like tiny messengers, pions carry important information within atoms.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, pions dance around like energetic little stars.

meanings.sent1: In the physics class, students discussed the properties of pions.
meanings.sent2: The bookshelf was filled with books on various pions.
meanings.sent3: The pions on the shelf seemed to be having a meeting of their own.
meanings.sent4: Among the collection, the pions stood out like colorful puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to count the pions in the container.
